intro: Porcelia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed porcelia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
